New Records: Harry Wilson became the first player since Gareth Bale to score in three consecutive games for Wales, matching Bale's Euro 2016 feat
Key Match Events: Wilson was outstanding as boss Craig Bellamy extended his unbeaten run to four games
Montenegro substitute Andrija Radulovic hit the woodwork
Wales kept their defensive shape well and ran few risks
Pre-Game Insights: Bellamy already has an eye on next year’s World Cup qualifiers and developing a squad for those matches
Despite making seven changes from the 2-2 draw in Iceland last Friday, Wales’ new-look team were fluent throughout the first half
Post-Match Reflections: Wales will tackle their final two matches in their Nations League group with optimism
Bellamy will be thrilled that unlike in the previous two matches, Wales kept their defensive shape well and ran few risks
Miscellaneous Highlights: Wales might have made it two when Nikic found himself in a muddle and was robbed by Brooks, who chose to pass not shoot and Burns fired over on the angle
Wales travel to group leaders Turkey and face Iceland at home next month
